Disclaimer

I wrote lottery function to learn golang.

 1 package main
 2 
 3 import (
 4   "math/rand"
 5   "fmt"
 6   "time"
 7 )
 8 
 9 func main() {
10   var ret = make(map[int]float32)
11 
12   for i:=0;i<10000;i++ {
13     ret[lottery()] += 1
14   }
15   fmt.Printf("ret[1]:%0.2f\n", ret[1] / 100)
16   fmt.Printf("ret[2]:%0.2f\n", ret[2] / 100)
17   fmt.Printf("ret[3]:%0.2f\n", ret[3] / 100)
18   fmt.Printf("ret[4]:%0.2f\n", ret[4] / 100)
19 }
20 
21 func lottery() int {
22   // Probability model
23   // 1 hit.  1/100 1, 1
24   // 2 hit. 10/100 2, 11
25   // 3 hit. 25/100 12, 36
26   // miss.  64/100 37, 100
27     rand.Seed( time.Now().UTC().UnixNano())
28   p := [4]int{1,10,25,64}
29   denomi := 100
30   r := rand.Intn(denomi)
31   //fmt.Printf("r:%d\n", r)
32   switch {
33   case r < p[0]: return 1
34   case r < (p[0] + p[1]) - 1: return 2
35   case r < (p[1] + p[2]) - 1: return 3
36   default: return 4
37   }
38 }

To Build and run as following:

╰─➤  go build lottery.go
╰─➤  ./lottery
ret[1]:0.79
ret[2]:9.07
ret[3]:24.32
ret[4]:65.82
